tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica status by finishing T7 at the Q-School played in Buenos Aires, Argentina in January… Made the cut in 11 of 15 starts, collecting three top-5s and six top-25s to finish the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked 15th on the Order of Merit… A solid week of four rounds of 70 or lower helped him share runner-up honors with Ángel Cabrera at the 84th Abierto OSDE del Centro in Cordoba, Argentina in April. Finished four strokes behind tournament champion Tommy Cocha for his best career finish on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica… Had two other top-5s in consecutive weeks late in the season, finishing fifth at the Punta del Este Roberto De Vicenzo Invitational in Uruguay and a T3 at the 100th VISA Open de Argentina in Buenos Aires… Closed the year with a T45 finish at the Web.com Tour Q-School final to earn exempt status thru the second reshuffle of the 2016 season.

2014: Missed the 54-hole cut at the PGA TOUR's AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am in February. That was his first PGA TOUR start as a professional… A T49 finish at the Midwest Classic was his only cut made in four starts on the Web.com Tour, where he had conditional status… Missed the cut at the Mundo Maya Open in his only start of the season on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica.

2013: Coming off his 2012 U.S. Amateur win, received nine invites to play PGA TOUR events as an amateur. Missed the cut in all nine. Among the events he was invited to play were three majors, the Masters Tournament, U.S. Open and The Open Championship... Made his debut as a professional by finishing T11 at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica's Puerto Rico Classic presented by Merrill Lynch in October… Finished T88 at the Web.com Tour Q-School Final in December to earn conditional status on the Web.com Tour for the 2014 season.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won the 2012 United States Amateur Championship by defeating Michael Weaver (Cal) in 37 holes at Cherry Hills Country Club. Qualified for match play as part of a 17-man group for 14 spots. Fox defeated Jeff Osberg (3&2), Dr. Douglas Hanzel (1up), Zack Munroe (2up), then-World No. 1 Chris Williams (4&2) and Brandon Hagy (2up) en route to the epic win… Represented USA winning Eisenhower Trophy at 2012 World Amateur Team Championship and to third-place finish at 2013 Copa de las Americas… Two-time PING All-East Region (2012, 2013) and three-time All-SoCon pick (2011, 2012, 2013)… 2011 TGA Match Play Champion… Shot a course-record 64 (-8) at the Club at Olde Stone in the second round of the NCAA Bowling Green Regional… His third-place finish in the regional helped the Mocs win their first NCAA Golf Regional… 51 par or better rounds with 17 in the 60's… 13 top 10's including eight top 5's with one win (2010 Furman Intercollegiate) and four runner-ups in his collegiate career… 4th all-time in scoring average (73.11) and par or better rounds (52)… Missed the cut in all nine of his starts on the PGA TOUR during the 2013 season, including The Masters Tournament, the U.S. Open and the British Open.
tourBios.personal: His mom, Maureen, played collegiate basketball at Long Island University, while his father, Alan, played professionally in Israel... The middle child in his family with an older sister Ashley and younger sister Kristen… Attended high school in Hendersonville, Tennessee… If not a professional golfer, would be a basketball player… Favorite course he played is Augusta National, which he did at the 2013 Masters Tournament as reigning U.S. Amateur champion… Favorite apps are Quizup and Candy Crush… Favorite teams are the University of Tennessee, the Tennessee Titans and the San Antonio Spurs… Favorite TV show is "The Big Bang Theory."… Favorite food is steak and sweet potatoes… Favorite vacation spot is the Bahamas or "anywhere it's warm."… Favorite athlete is LeBron James ("What's not to like about his life?")… Dream foursome would be Michael Jordan, Peyton Manning and Tiger Woods… Bucket list includes skydiving, visiting Hawaii, Australia and the Swiss Alps… Motto is "No excuse. Play like a champion."… Supports The First Tee of Chattanooga…  Twitter/Instagram: @stevenfox4.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (subject to second reshuffle)

tourBios.otherCarHigh: Defeated Michael Weaver on the 37th hole after being 2-down with two to play to win the 2012 U.S. Amateur at Cherry Hills CC in Denver, Colo...Was three-time All-Southern Conference selection (2011-2013) and a member of the All-Freshman team in 2010 at the University of Tennessee-Chattanooga...Had 13 top-10s, including eight top-fives and one win (2010 Furman Intercollegiate) and four runners-up...Played on the winning U.S. team at the 2012 World Amateur Team Championship...Won 2011 Tennessee Golf Association Match Play Championship...Won 2008 Tennessee Junior Amateur Championship.
tourBios.personal: Attended high school in Hendersonville, Tenn...If not a professional golfer, would be a basketball player...Favorite course he played is Augusta National, which he did in 2013 as reigning U.S. Amateur champion...Favorite apps are Quizup and Candy Crush...Favorite teams are the University of Tennesse, the Tennessee Titans and the San Antonio Spurs...Favorite TV show is "The Big Bang Theory."...Favorite food is steak and sweet potatoes...Favorite vacation spot is the Bahamas or "anywhere it's warm."...Favorite athlete is LeBron James ("What's not to like about his life?")...Dream foursome would be Michael Jordan, Peyton Manning and Tiger Woods...Bucket list includes skydiving, visiting Hawaii, Australia and the Swiss Alps...Motto is "No excuse. Play like a champion."...Supports The First Tee of Chattanooga...Mom played collegiate basketball at Long Island University, while his father played professionally in Israel...Twitter/Instagram name is @stevenfox4.
tourBios.ntlTeams: 2012 World Amateur Team Championship, 2013 Copa de las Americas

tourBios.carHigh: 2014: Made one cut in three starts, T8 at the ATB Financial Classic.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was T2nd in 2015 at the 84 Abierto OSDE del Centro presentado por Fiber Corp.
